Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
NAICS Translation: 331210: Iron and Steel Pipe and Tube Manufacturing from Purchased Steel
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: To settle a Clean Air Act case, Nucor agreed to spend $85 million on new emission controls, pay a $9 million civil penalty and spend $4 million on emission monitoring.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2000/December/703enrd.htm

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 238120: Structural Steel and Precast Concrete Contractors
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

Description: Nucor unsuccessfully appealed the verdict, which concerned racial harassment claims by six workers, to the U.S. Supreme Court.
Private Litigation Case Title: Bennett, et al v. Nucor Corporation, et al
Info Source: https://h2o.law.harvard.edu/cases/3608

Private Litigation Case Title: Brown, et al v. Nucor Corporation, et al
Info Source: https://www.postandcourier.com/business/judge-approves-m-settlement-in-nucor-steel-mill-discrimination-case/article_22140262-126e-11e8-8940-abdd6a5db284.html

Description: Nucor agreed to pay $13 million to settle a lawsuit brought by seven states alleging it failed to control the amount of pollution released by its facilities. This was part of a larger $98 million settlement also involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-nucor-corporation
